activities.loc: Br 2 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob C Miller

records.addlTxt: Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Warrant sent to RCSO/dispatch for entry

9:09 AM Defendant Jacob C Miller not in court.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Jacob C Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense has no explanation for the non appearance.  Defense spoke to the defendant before his release from jail. State requests a warrant. BTC:  No appearance by defendant, Arrest/Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond to be forfeited.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Comply with ATR terms and plan the agent sets up. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Letter from Defense Counsel re: Release
Letter from Defendant's Program Manager re: Release

9:26 AM Defendant Jacob C Miller in court, in custody.  Attorney Clare Kathleen Schum in court for Jacob C Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense files a bond motion and makes further argument.  BTC: Bond motion granted, all cases reduced to signature bonds, It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  Must live at the Sober living facility.  Must have confirmation in writing from the Jesse Crawford Center that they would report any violations or non compliance to the court in writing before bonds will be converted.
Bail/bond hearing on September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
defense

9:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob C Miller not in court.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Jacob C Miller. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Defense has been informed that the defendant was completing a residential treatment program by an a probation agent.  Defense has reached out to that agent and has not heard back.  Defense asks for a stayed warrant. State askes for a Warrant.  BTC:  No appearance by defendant, Arrest/Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond to be forfeited.** STAYED UNTIL JULY 12 AT 8:30AM.**
6-10 rescheduled per defense request
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for an adj.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Comply with ATR terms and plan the agent sets up.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

9:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jacob C Miller appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Alexander J. Kostal for Jacob C Miller appeared in court. Court reporter Linda Matoska. Defense files a bond motion.  Defense makes further argument.  DOC is looking to put Mr. Miller in a treatment facility in lieu of revocation.  Defense is unsure how long the program will take, but will get more information from DOC.  The defendant is on a PO hold. Court has concerns there would be a gap between being released on signature bond and getting a bed at the treatment facility.  State defers to the court.  BTC: Bond modified to the defendant must comply with the ATR terms and plan the agent sets up.  Both cases converted to $500 signature bonds.
Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
